intro: Ceropegia cumingiana f. merrillii, commonly known as the variegated string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which are pollinated by specific insects. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish.
